Detailed Description

WINNIE_ALLOC_USE_MALLOC_THRESHOLD

WINNIE_ALLOC_STATISTIC_ENABLED

WINNIE_ALLOC_THROW_STD_BADALLOC

Variable Documentation

const unsigned Winnie::Config::first_os_block_size_log = 20
 

winnie_alloc library takes big chunks of memory from system. this is (logarithm of) minimal size of such block:

const size_t Winnie::Config::malloc_threshold = 1024
 

if requested size of memory is greater or equal `malloc_threshold`, then standart function malloc used. winnie_alloc rounds size of every requested block to the next power of two, so when user allocate very big blocks, winnie_alloc can exhaust 32-bits memory address space. You can use malloc for big blocks. Winnie recommends make frequently allocated blocks duty of winnie_alloc library, and big unfrequently allocated blocks leave for std::malloc
